meanings.sent1: The cat sculks through the bushes, trying to catch a bird.
meanings.sent2: He sculks around the house, hoping to surprise his friends.
meanings.sent3: The spy sculks behind the enemy lines, gathering valuable information.

meanings.definition: To behave in a cowardly or sneaky manner.
meanings.sent1: He sculks away from confrontations, preferring to avoid any trouble.
meanings.sent2: The bully sculks behind the school building, waiting to pick on someone.
meanings.sent3: The raccoon sculks away with the stolen cookies, guilty but satisfied.
meanings.sent4: Guilt sculks in his heart, making him avoid eye contact.
meanings.sent5: The shadow of doubt sculks in the corners of her mind, clouding her judgment.
